DataElement.preferredName: Retroperitoneal Soft Tissue Sarcoma AJCC Edition 8 Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group based on the combination of T, N, and M categories and relevant prognostic factors for soft tissue sarcoma of the retroperitoneum using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Retroperitoneum Soft Tissue Sarcoma Stage Grouping
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The back of the abdomen where the kidneys lie and the great blood vessels run._A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The back of the abdomen where the kidneys lie and the great blood vessels run.:A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones.

Concepts.definition: The back of the abdomen where the kidneys lie and the great blood vessels run.
A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones.

Property.preferredDefinition: Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.definition: An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: TL released; 2/24/22.; 4-3-19 created for standardization; tmt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Retroperitoneum American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A term that refers to the staging of retroperitoneal soft tissue sarcoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to common sarcomas in the retroperitoneum. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IV Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IV Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IV includes: Any T, Any N, M1, Any G. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IV includes: Any T, Any N, M1, Any G. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IIIB Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IIIB Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIB includes: (T3, T4, N0, M0, G2, G3); (Any T, N1, M0, Any G). T3: Tumor measuring more than 10 cm and less than or equal to 15 cm in greatest dimension. T4: Tumor measuring more than 15 cm in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis or unknown lymph node status. N1: Regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G2: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 4 or 5. G3: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 6, 7, or 8. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIB Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIB includes: (T3, T4, N0, M0, G2, G3); (Any T, N1, M0, Any G). T3: Tumor measuring more than 10 cm and less than or equal to 15 cm in greatest dimension. T4: Tumor measuring more than 15 cm in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis or unknown lymph node status. N1: Regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G2: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 4 or 5. G3: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 6, 7, or 8. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IIIA Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IIIA Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIA includes: T2, N0, M0, G2, G3. T2: Tumor measuring more than 5 cm and less than or equal to 10 cm in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis or unknown lymph node status. M0: No distant metastasis. G2: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 4 or 5. G3: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 6, 7, or 8. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIA Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIA includes: T2, N0, M0, G2, G3. T2: Tumor measuring more than 5 cm and less than or equal to 10 cm in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis or unknown lymph node status. M0: No distant metastasis. G2: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 4 or 5. G3: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 6, 7, or 8. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage II Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage II Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II includes: T1, N0, M0, G2, G3. T1: Tumor measuring 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis or unknown lymph node status. M0: No distant metastasis. G2: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 4 or 5. G3: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 6, 7, or 8. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: T1, N0, M0, G2, G3. T1: Tumor measuring 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis or unknown lymph node status. M0: No distant metastasis. G2: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 4 or 5. G3: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 6, 7, or 8. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IB Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IB Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IB includes: T2, T3, T4, N0, M0, G1, GX. T2: Tumor measuring more than 5 cm and less than or equal to 10 cm in greatest dimension. T3: Tumor measuring more than 10 cm and less than or equal to 15 cm in greatest dimension. T4: Tumor measuring more than 15 cm in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis or unknown lymph node status. M0: No distant metastasis. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G1: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 2 or 3. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IB Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IB includes: T2, T3, T4, N0, M0, G1, GX. T2: Tumor measuring more than 5 cm and less than or equal to 10 cm in greatest dimension. T3: Tumor measuring more than 10 cm and less than or equal to 15 cm in greatest dimension. T4: Tumor measuring more than 15 cm in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis or unknown lymph node status. M0: No distant metastasis. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G1: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 2 or 3. (AJCC 8th ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stage IA Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stage IA Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IA includes: T1, N0, M0, G1, GX. T1: Tumor measuring 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis or unknown lymph node status. M0: No distant metastasis. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G1: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 2 or 3. (AJCC 8th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IA Retroperitoneal Sarcoma AJCC v8
Concepts.definition: Stage IA includes: T1, N0, M0, G1, GX. T1: Tumor measuring 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis or unknown lymph node status. M0: No distant metastasis. GX: Grade cannot be assessed. G1: Total differentiation, mitotic count and necrosis score of 2 or 3. (AJCC 8th ed.)
